YTUARTE--Martin F. A beloved father and businessman, at age 77. Born to Justo and Josephine Ytuarte in New York City in 1936. Always an industrious and hard worker. Involved in his father's businesses in locations all over lower Manhattan. Graduate of finance and business administration at St. John's University. A true New Yorker, he worked for over 25 years at One World Trade Center as Executive Vice President of Prudential Lines. He was then asked by Hugo Neu to be the Vice President and General Manager of River Terminal, a commercial real estate company, where he worked for 27 years. As a businessman, Marty was known for his integrity and honesty. He was both a leader and a mentor to many over his long and distinguished career. He was also a family man who was devoted to his family. He was always the consummate host and welcomed everyone into his home. He is survived by his wife Norma, his daughters Jacqueline and Helen White, his beloved grandchildren, Olympia and Orlando and his brother Ray Ytuarte. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell at 1076 Madison Ave on Friday, April 25th from 2-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral Mass to be held at Holy Trinity Church on Saturday, April 26th, 10am, 213 West 82nd St. In lieu of flowers, please send any donations to: Holy Trinity Church Food Program or The Wounded Warrior Project.
WEISS--Neil, Our table at the Friars Club was a very sad place yesterday Neil and always will be for me. Your pal, John V.

WEHLE--Anne Franklin, of Lloyd Harbor, NY, died peacefully on April 8th at the age of 93. Born in Warsaw, IN the only child of George and Mary Franklin. Valedictorian of her class at Warsaw High School, attended DePauw University and graduated with the Class of 1943 from Vassar College with a degree in Early Childhood Development. She went on to join the staff of the childcare department of Grumman Aircraft where she met aeronautical engineer L. Brandeis Wehle who became her beloved husband of 60 years. Brand predeceased her in 2007. Anne was a devoted mother and grandmother and an active member of her community. She served on the board of directors of Planned Parenthood of Suffolk County and volunteered for other local organizations including Huntington Hospital, Family Service League, North Shore Holiday House and Old First Church. She became a nurse later in life and thoroughly enjoyed her second career caring for patients at Huntington Hospital. An avid golfer, Anne twice hit a hole-in-one in 1976 and was an active tennis and platform tennis player as well as an inveterate sun-worshipper. At the time of her death she was the senior member of the Huntington Country Club and the Lloyd Neck Bath Club. She is survived by her daughter Nancy Aboff (Michael), Susan Wehle, Jonathan Wehle and grandchildren Matthew, Susannah (Brad) and Gareth. Here son Robert predeceased her in 2011. Anne believed that hers had been a very lucky life. Throughout the arc of that life, she was a sunny and optimistic person whose kindness, warmth and generosity were felt by all those around her. Anne will deeply missed by her family and her many friends. A memorial service will be held on May 3rd at 11am at Old First Church in Huntington, NY. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Huntington Hospital or Planned Parenthood of Hudson Peconic.
WEISS--Neil, We are devastated at the loss of our dear friend Neil and extend our most heartfelt sympathies to Virginia, Ken, Jennifer and the rest of the Weiss family. Lynne and John Vassallo

FRIED--Dr. Robert. Age 89, passed away in West Palm Beach, FL on April 22, 2014. Beloved husband of Helen for 34 years, loving father of Janet and the late Dr. Alan Studley, Robin Fried and Dr. Jacob Steinberg and Tarra Fried. Dear grandfather of Nolan and Brooke Studley and Hersh Steinberg and the late Michael Simon Steinberg. Devoted brother of Gerald Fried. Loved stepfather of Patti Seymour, Pam Fox and Ben Joravsky. Boppy of Terence, Elissa, Ryan, Hannah and Rachel. He was a kind, compassionate dentist in Mamaroneck, NY for over fifty three years, highly respected by his patients and colleagues and office manager D. Jane Blizzard. He served as president of the Ninth District Dental Society and was Former Chair of the Peer Review Committee. He was a member of the New York State Dental Association as well as the American Dental Association. In 1998 he received the D. Austin Sniffen Medal of Honor. His million dollar smile will never be forgotten. He was loved by all whose lives he touched. His graveside ceremony will be held on Monday, April 28th at 11am, Mount Eden Cemetery, 20 Commerce Street, Hawthorne, NY 10532. www.mountedencemetary.org Donations in his memory can be sent to Lymphoma Research Foundation, 115 Broadway, Suite 1301, New York, NY 10006 or Larchmont Temple, 75 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538, where his Bar Mitzvah was at the age of 60.

PERNICK--David. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of David Pernick, beloved husband of the late Frances. His exceptional philanthropic traditions live on through the generosity of his cherished family. We extend our condolences to David's children Jill Friedman (Mitchell) and Bruce (Susan); his grandchildren; and the entire family. Alisa R. Doctoroff, President; Linda Mirels, Chair of the Board; John S. Ruskay, Executive VP & CEO

BESHAR--Robert. Westchester Community College and the Westchester Community College Foundation extend our sympathies to the family of our friend Robert Beshar. An active Foundation Board member, he contributed to the college in many ways. He will be missed.

MANSFIELD--Maria. The Board and Staff of Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts mourn the passing of Maria Mansfield, a tour guide at Lincoln Center for a record 47 years. Mansfield, a native of Italy who came to New York to study acting, was hired by Lincoln Center on September 5, 1967 to give tours of the campus. Mansfield poured her passion for music and flair for dramatic description into her tours, making them a hit with visitors of all ages, particularly children. In her five decades at Lincoln Center she met and interacted with many of the great personalities in the arts, including Leonard Bernstein, Marc Chagall who gave a spontaneous lecture to her group one day and Luciano Pavarotti. We extend our sympathies to her husband, family and friends, and to all who have been touched by her work for Lincoln Center. Katherine Farley, Chair Jed Bernstein, President Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts

DWYER--Philip, of New York City and Sneem, Ireland, age 87, on April 23, 2014. Husband of the late Mary (nee Molloy). Survived by his sons and their wives, Pat and Kathy, Jim and Cathy, Phil and Denise, John and Marilyn; his brother Frank; and his grandchildren, Maura, Catherine, Kevin, Brendan, Clare, Joseph, Aidan, Maeve, Liam and Patrick. For memorials please consider the Michael J. Fox Foundation or Doctors Without Borders. The wake will be in the Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home, Saturday, 7-9pm, and Sunday, 2-4pm and 7-9pm. Mass on Monday, 11:30am at St. Ignatius Loyola, 980 Park Ave.

GOLD--Hattie, eldest daughter of "Russ and Daughters" died April 17, at 101 years. Survived by son Paul, five grandchildren and nine great-grandchildren. Devoted husband of 57 years, Murray Gold, died in 1992. Beloved daughter Nina Silverman died in 2009. Sister Ida died in 1999. Youngest sister Ann lives in Florida.

MAXWELL--Hamish. PBMC Health would like to recognize the tremendous support from Hamish & Georgene (Gee Gee) Maxwell. We extend our condolences to the family. Sherry Patterson, Chair, PBMC Health Board of Directors Gordon Huszagh, Chair, PBMC Health Foundation Board of Directors Andrew J. Mitchell, FACHE, President & CEO, PBMC Health & Peconic Bay Medical Center
ACONSKY--Simon Sidney. On April 24, 2014. Honorary NYFD Battalion Chief. Services Sunday, 1:15pm at "The Riverside" 76th Street and Amsterdam Avenue.

GREENBERG--Leonard, age 91, of New Rochelle, passed away on April 23. Beloved husband of the late Elaine, loving father of Arthur (Julie Blatt) and Debra, and devoted grandfather of Jane. Funeral services Friday, April 25 at 1:30pm at George T. Davis Funeral Home, 14 Lecount Place, New Rochelle, NY 10801 914-632-0324. Shiva at family home Sunday 11:30am-5:30pm and Monday 11am-3pm. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the New Rochelle Public Library or an animal rescue fund.

MARTIN--Oliver W. III, activist, convener, parishioner and friend, died on April 19, 2014 at the age of 55. Founder of Conscious Contact of New York, longtime board member of AIDS Service Center NYC, board president for the United Church of Christ's National HIV and AIDS Network, and creator of Spiritual Outreach Services, Oliver was a man of wisdom, faith, grace and love. He is survived by his partner Craig Kania, and hundreds of friends and colleagues.

HARRISON--Phyllis Haggerty, a journalist, a traveler and a lover of fine cooking died of lung cancer on April 23rd in Cortlandt Manor, NY. She was 87. Phyllis was born April 14th, 1927 in Arlington, MA to Thomas and Henrietta Haggerty. She graduated from Boston University with a degree in Journalism. She worked as Publicity Director for several airlines-including Northwest Orient Airlines and Sabena Airlines-and contributed to numerous travel books. Phyllis married Basil Fraser Harrison in 1960 in New York, NY. They were happily married for 38 years before Basil died in 1998. Phyllis was an active member of the American Association of University Women for over 50 years where she helped empower women through education. Phyllis is survived by her sons Alexander Fraser Harrison of Croton-on-Hudson, NY and Scott Fraser Harrison of Bainbridge Island, WA; their wives and four granddaughters. Visitation will be held at Carter Funeral Home in Croton-on-Hudson NY on Sunday, April 27th from 2-4pm and 7-9pm. Funeral services will be held at St. Augustine's Episcopal Church in Croton-on-Hudson, NY on Monday, April 28th at 11am. Memorial donations can be made to the American Association of University Women at www.aauw.org/ contribute. Additional details: EFCarterFuneralHome.com.

SACHS--Eva, nee Ziffer, died peacefully on April 20, 2014. Survived by husband George, children Irene and Michael, and grandchildren Emily, Jeffrey, Karen, and Rachel. Memorial service Sunday, April 27, 11am at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue.

SAYARE--Katherine Rachel. We are terribly saddened to have to announce the death of Kate Sayare, our daughter, sister, fiancee and friend. Kate died suddenly and unexpectedly in New York City on April 15. She was 27. The cause of death is not yet known. Kate's warmth, expansiveness and depth of heart touched so very many. Our lives have grown smaller for her absence. A memorial service and reception will be held Friday, April 25, at 5:30 pm at the Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Planned Parenthood League of Massachusetts or to Horizons for Homeless Children, also in Massachusetts.
HARTENSTEIN--Florence. A myriad of Aunt Florrie memories will live in our hearts forever. Boas and Claster Families

KASS--Gerald H.,MD, age 91, of Ramsey, NJ and Southampton, NY, died on April 22, 2014. He is predeceased by his wife, Roberta T. Kass. He is survived by his children, Aimee Kass, Wendy Niceberg, and Brett Kass. Graduated from New York Medical College, Dr. Kass was a fellow in cardiology at Mt. Sinai Hospital in New York City. He was a dedicated and respected Physician in Ramsey, practicing from 1955-1998. Dr. Kass was the first cardiologist in Ramsey and was at the forefront of specialty internal medicine. He also built Doctors Park, a medical complex in Ramsey and was very influential in the development of the region's medical community. He was a founder of Valley Hospital in Ridgewood, NJ. Dr. Kass was a long standing member of the Tuxedo Club and the Southampton Golf Club. A memorial service will be held Sunday, at 2:30pm at the Van Emburgh Funeral Home, 109 Darlington Ave., Ramsey, NJ 201-327-0030. www.vanemburghsneider.com

KOUNDAKJIAN--Harry, Photojournalist born 1930, died on April 21, 2014 in New York City. Survivors are his beloved wife Aida, son Vicken and daughter Lola. Services will be on Saturday at 1pm at the Armenian Evangelical Church of New York, 152 East 34th Street. In lieu of flowers, a donation in Harry's memory to Beth Israel Hospital.

LONG--Arthur Francis Jr.,died April 23, 2014 in North Palm Beach, FL after a life long battle against diabetes. Art was a former resident of Garden City, NY and recently North Palm Beach, FL. Survived by his sister Dana, brothers Thomas A. and James E. and nine loving nieces and nephews. Art was a former executive at D.F. King & Co., Inc. for over 20 years. An avid car collector and enthusiast, who shared his love of adventure with all. As a cherished family member, Art will be deeply missed. A memorial service will be held at The Cathedral of the Incarnation, Garden City, 10am on April 26, 2014.

KIRSCH--Robert. Westchester Community College and the Westchester Community College Foundation extend condolences to the family of our friend Robert Kirsch. An eloquent and generous supporter, this Foundation Board member improved the lives of many of our students.

KRIPKE--Rabbi Myer S. The Jewish Theological Seminary joins the family in mourning the loss of Myer S. Kripke, esteemed rabbi, philanthropist, scholar, and JTS alumnus. Omaha, Nebraska, remains forever enriched because of his work there as a pulpit rabbi, champion of interfaith dialogue, and friend to all communities. Devoted to his cherished wife--author Dorothy Karp Kripke (z"l), whom he met at JTS--and beloved family, Rabbi Kripke and Dorothy impacted the greater JTS and Jewish community when they helped restore JTS's fire-devastated Library tower. Redesignated the Kripke Tower, it stands even taller today because it bears the couple's deeply respected name. May the family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Arnold M. Eisen, Chancellor Abby Joseph Cohen, Board Chair

RICE--Margaret. Westchester Community College and the Westchester Community College Foundation mourn the loss of our friend Margaret Rice. Our thoughts go out to her family as we honor the memory of this Foundation Board member who supported our students and our Children's Center.

SIDERIS--George John, 87, of Fort Lee, NJ passed away at his home with his family by his side on April 24th, 2014. George is survived by Mary (nee Skouras), his beloved wife of 60 years, and two children Diane and John. George was born in Athens Greece and raised in New York's Hell's Kitchen where he attended High School of Commerce. After serving in World War II as a US Army Staff Sergeant, George came home to earn a Bachelor of Science in Economics from NYU. George had an illustrious career in Finance till he retired as Chief Financial Officer for Long Island Lighting Company in 1992. Loving husband, devoted father, fiercely loyal friend, indomitable spirit and honest as day is long. George will be missed more than words can say but will be remembered for the love he had in his heart for everyone he met, his ever present smile and his determined optimism best captured in his favorite phrase "I'm in good shape for the shape that I'm in". A viewing will be held on Sunday, April 27th from 4pm-9pm at AK Macagnas Funeral home, 495 Anderson Avenue in Cliffside Park, NJ. The funeral will take place on Monday, April 28th at 11:30am at Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church in New Rochelle, NY. Burial, immediately following, at Mount Hope Cemetery in Hastings, NY. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the American Cancer Society.
TISHMAN--Marcia. Mom, your love, compassion and support continue to inspire us. We miss you so much. Kisses to Dad. Love, Steven, Andy, Michael and Robert
LIFTON--Richard Zane . A year has passed and we think of you every day. You are forever in our hearts.

SOMMERS--Edmond, 90 of Tenafly, New Jersey, peacefully on April 24, 2014. Survivors include his beloved wife Sylvia, daughter Joan, son Daniel, daughter-in-law Lillian and grandson Benjamin. Services Sunday, 11am at "Eden Memorial Chapel", 327 Main Street, Fort Lee, New Jersey. 201-947-3336.
WEISS--Neil. A funny, warm, generous and vibrant guy. We will sorely miss him. We send our love to Virginia and the entire family. Hedy and Arthur Goldberg
HEREDIA--Emile. April 26, 1941- July 21, 2011 "'Remembered with love by your family and countless friends"

KOLKER--Dr. Joseph, passed away peacefully at home on April 25, 2014. Born in Washington, D.C., 1921 (to Sara and Sam Kolker); married 70 years to Frances (Kressin), whom he had known and loved since kindergarten. Graduated George Washington University and George Washington Medical School (B.A., M.D.). Internship and residency at Mt. Sinai, 1943-1945. Served in the Navy aboard USS Repose (hospital ship) in Tsingtao, China, 1945-1947. Entered psychoanalytic training after the war. Joined staff of Downstate University and Mt. Sinai Hospital, New York. Became liaison psychiatrist under Dr. Henry Dolger to the Diabetic Medical Service for 30 years until 2005. In private practice from 1950 until 2010. On the staff of Bellevue's Psychiatric Clinic until his death. President of the Psychoanalytic Association of New York (PANY) 1985 and 1986. Loved, cherished, and will missed deeply by his wife, Frances, his sister and brothers, his children Susan Finkel, Jeanne Stern, in-laws Derek Stern, Suzan Kolker, eight grandchildren, three great-grandchildren. Predeceased by his son, William Kolker in 2012 and son-in-law Donald Finkel in 1999. In lieu of flowers, please send memorials to Mt. Sinai Department of Psychiatry, George Washington University, or UJA. Services will be held at Sunday, April 27th, 12:45pm at Riverside Memorial Chapel, Amsterdam and 76th.

KASS--Gerald H.,MD, age 91, of Ramsey, NJ and Southampton, NY, died on April 22, 2014. He is predeceased by his wife, Roberta T. Kass. He is survived by his children, Aimee Kass, Wendy Niceberg, and Brett Kass. Graduated from New York Medical College, Dr. Kass was a fellow in cardiology at Mt. Sinai Hospital in New York City. He was a dedicated and respected Physician in Ramsey, practicing from 1955-1998. Dr. Kass was the first cardiologist in Ramsey and was at the forefront of specialty internal medicine. He also built Doctors Park, a medical complex in Ramsey and was very influential in the development of the region's medical community. He was a founder of Valley Hospital in Ridgewood, NJ. Dr. Kass was a long standing member of the Tuxedo Club and the Southampton Golf Club. A memorial service will be held Sunday, at 2:30pm at the Van Emburgh Funeral Home, 109 Darlington Ave., Ramsey, NJ 201-327-0030. www.vanemburghsneider.com

GOLD--Hattie, eldest daughter of "Russ and Daughters" died April 17, at 101 years. Survived by son Paul, five grandchildren and nine great-grandchildren. Devoted husband of 57 years, Murray Gold, died in 1992. Beloved daughter Nina Silverman died in 2009. Sister Ida died in 1999. Youngest sister Ann lives in Florida.

GREEN--Ronald Peter. September 29, 1924 to April 22, 2014. Son of Helen Green, partner of Frederick (Al) Schneider. Passed away peacefully on April 22, 2014 surrounded by friends and family. A private celebration of his life was held on April 24, 2014 with burial following.

GELMAN--Bernard, on April 24, 2014 at 91 years of age. Loving husband of Terry Gelman. Devoted father of Debra Hurley (Mike) and Susan Sussman (Barry). Grandfather to Rachel Maeroff (Mike) and great-grandfather to Fern Maeroff. Financial Analyst of the New York Port Authority. Veteran of WWII. Any donations may be made to the American Heart Association. Funeral will be held on Sunday, April 27, 10am, graveside at Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, NY.

LLOYD--Derek. The Board and Staff of The New 42nd Street and The New Victory Theater are deeply saddened by the untimely death of our dear Mary Rose Lloyd's beloved husband, Derek Lloyd. Derek was adored by all who were lucky enough to know him, as he was irresistibly warm and charming, gentle and oh so spirited. We embrace Mary with all our hearts. Fiona Rudin, Chairman Cora Cahan, President

FRIED--Dr. Robert. Age 89, passed away in West Palm Beach, FL on April 22, 2014. Beloved husband of Helen for 34 years, loving father of Janet and the late Dr. Alan Studley, Robin Fried and Dr. Jacob Steinberg and Tarra Fried. Dear grandfather of Nolan and Brooke Studley and Hersh Steinberg and the late Michael Simon Steinberg. Devoted brother of Gerald Fried. Loved stepfather of Patti Seymour, Pam Fox and Ben Joravsky. Boppy of Terence, Elissa, Ryan, Hannah and Rachel. He was a kind, compassionate dentist in Mamaroneck, NY for over fifty three years, highly respected by his patients and colleagues and office manager D. Jane Bizzard. He served as president of the Ninth District Dental Society and was Former Chair of the Peer Review Committee. He was a member of the New York State Dental Association as well as the American Dental Association. In 1998 he received the D. Austin Sniffen Medal of Honor. His million dollar smile will never be forgotten. He was loved by all whose lives he touched. His graveside ceremony will be held on Monday, April 28th at 11am, Mount Eden Cemetery, 20 Commerce Street, Hawthorne, NY 10532. www.mountedencemetary.org Donations in his memory can be sent to Lymphoma Research Foundation, 115 Broadway, Suite 1301, New York, NY 10006 or Larchmont Temple, 75 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538, where his Bar Mitzvah was at the age of 60.

AHERN--Geary E.,MD, beloved husband of Mary and father of Christopher, died unexpectedly on April 23. Wake: 3-6pm, Sunday, April 27 at Hannemann Funeral Home, 88 South Broadway, Nyack, NY. Funeral: 11am, Monday, April 28 at St. Ann's Catholic Church, 16 Jefferson St., Nyack, NY. In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to the National Multiple Sclerosis Society.
EIREF--Zvi, on April 17, 2014 Beloved husband of Catherine (Lindy), father of Daniel, Benjamin and Simon and grandfather to six grandchildren in Princeton, New Jersey, USA.

SACHS--Eva, nee Ziffer, died peacefully on April 20, 2014. Survived by husband George, children Irene and Michael, and grandchildren Emily, Jeffrey, Karen, and Rachel. Memorial service Sunday, April 27, 11am at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue.

SAVITT--David Charles, of Delray Beach, FL, formerly of Fort Lee, NJ, died on April 24, 2014 at age 90, surrounded by his family. A loving husband, father and grandfather, David is survived by his wife of 55 years Joan Resnick Savitt and his daughters Marcy Savitt Kessler and Robin Savitt Kraus. He also leaves his sons-in-law Brian Kessler and Andrew Kraus as well as four grandsons Michael Kessler, Eric Kessler, Jason Kraus and Adam Kraus. He was born and raised in New York City and was a graduate of City College of NY. A veteran of World War II, he served as a medic in the army in Europe. He was the owner and president of Pace Press, a commercial printing company. David was a past president of Montammy Country Club. Family was his first priority and he loved watching his grandsons grow up. David was an avid golfer who would play whenever possible. He always enjoyed being out with friends and leaves many behind. Funeral services will be Sunday at 10:30am at Beth Israel Memorial Chapel in Delray Beach. Donations may be sent to Hospice of the Palm Beaches or the charity of your choice.
MARTIN--Oliver Wendell III. HIV-AIDS advocate, died on April 19, 2014. See expanded obituary at molthen-bell.com.

SCHWARTZMAN--Jori Ellen. Passed away after a fatal illness on April 15, twelve days short of her 71st birthday on April 27, leaving behind her mother Teri, her brothers Andrew and Paul, and her sister-in-law Linda. She was a loyal alumna of NYU, from which she received bachelors' and masters' degrees. She also leaves behind a host of loyal friends and relatives. Her ashes will be distributed on the Long Island Sound with her father's on her birthday.
